raw_text:
Venus stunned by Farina Elia
 
 Venus Williams suffered a first-round defeat for the first time in four years at the Dubai Championships.
 
 Sylvia Farina Elia, who had lost all nine of her previous meetings with the American fifth seed, won 7-5 7-6 (8-6). Former Wimbledon champion Conchita Martinez and India's Sania Mirza, the oldest and youngest players in the draw, also reached the second round. Martinez, 32, beat Shinobu Asagoe 6-4 6-4 and 18-year-old Mirza beat Jelena Kostanic 6-7 (7-2) 6-4 6-1. Mirza, the first Indian woman to win a WTA Tour title this month on home ground at Hyderabad, will now face US Open champion Svetlana Kuznetsova.
 
 But she is remaining confident. "She (Kuznetsova) is a great player," she said. "But everyone is beatable and I am looking forward to a great match." Williams though blamed her defeat by Farina Elia on injuries. "Blisters were a factor, but mostly my stomach wasn't that great," she said. "I did it in the last tournament in the semi-finals, and I was serving at 40% in the final. "The first time I served again was Sunday and there wasn't a lot I could do out there. When your serve isn't good it throws the rest of your game off too." She will wait to see how she recovers before deciding whether to take part in the Nasdaq-100 Open in Miami, starting on 21 March.

Mirza will face Svetlana Kuznetsova in the third round.

Williams blamed injuries for her defeat, including blisters and stomach issues. She may not play in Miami's Nasdaq-100 Open yet.

qwen2.5:0.5b: Venus Williams was defeated by Farina Elia at the Dubai Championships and did not finish the first round of the tournament. Sylvia Farina Elia reached the second round, beating both Sania Mirza (India) and Shinobu Asagoe (Japan). Mirza won on Monday after losing in the semi-final to Kostanic but was beaten 7-6 (8-6) by Kuznetsova at the first match. Williams blamed her defeat on injuries, saying "Blisters were a factor, but mostly my stomach wasn't that great." She will be waiting to see how she recovers before deciding whether or not to take part in the Nasdaq-100 Open in Miami.

Mirza will now face US Open champion Svetlana Kuznetsova in the next match. Williams blamed injuries on her defeat, saying it was affecting her serve which affected other parts of her game.

Other players like Conchita Martinez and Sania Mirza advanced to the second round. Williams blamed injuries for her loss, mentioning blisters and stomach issues affecting her serve. She awaits recovery before deciding if she will participate in the Nasdaq-100 Open in Miami.

However, she is still confident in her performance despite the defeat. She believes that Elia could have been a better player due to the injuries suffered.

tinyllama:1.1b: Venus Williams was stunned by Sylvia Farina Elia at the Dubai Championships for the first time in four years. The American was defeated by Farina Elia in her fifth meeting and fell to fifth seed Sylvia, who secured a spot in the second round with a 7-5, 7-6 (8-6) victory over Shinobu Asagoe. Despite being injured, Williams expressed confidence for the upcoming Miami Open, citing that injuries are "not great" and she is looking forward to a strong match against Svetlanna Kuznetsova. However, she will wait to decide if she'll participate in the Nasdaq-100 Open starting on 21 March.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Venus Williams experienced a disappointing first-round match at Dubai Championships. However, her coach, Mardy Fish, was able to mitigate Farina Elia's advantageous gameplay and secure a victory for his opponent. Despite serving with blisters at 40% in the final, Farina Elia was able to secure a thrilling victory. As she bounced back from the setback, Venus Williams remained confident about her upcoming tournament.
